title: Road to Cassandra 4.0 with Josh McKenzie | DataStax
description: When will Cassandra 4.0 be ready? DataStax VP of Engineering Josh McKenzie joins Aleks Volochnev to discuss his background as a member of the Project Management Committee for Apache Cassandra and the community collaboration involved in delivering the next major release of our favorite open source database.

december 31st um i i would i would aspirationally say it sometime in the fall of this year we'll have a 40ga hit um and a lot of that is going to be up to a lot of people working really really hard and you know volunteering their time and their heartbeats and their energy to really engage with this process which is which is a huge thing which may what makes open source really different than a lot of other a lot of other you know tribes you can associate with okay so final word there is a lot of people watching us who are cassandra users what would you say to tell to them to make cassandra happen uh sooner and faster uh engage with this testing like as soon as that beta is cut or even now because like we're only five tickets away from beta it's not going to be that different than where we are now um get this thing installed kick the tires try it out test it out and if you're a software engineer and you want to start getting involved with the project absolutely come on like hop on jira ask hop on to the the asf slack for the cassandra dev channel ask how you can help out there's a bunch of people that are super excited and interested in like onboarding and mentoring new people onto the project um there has never been a better time to get involved with things and so that's what i would say is if you want to see the release sooner get involved and let's get here sooner together and even if you are maybe not ready right now to engage into their development you always can find a warm place in the field of documentation i bet absolutely yes absolutely thank you so that was judge mckenzie and alex volchniv from data stocks and see you next time thanks a lot thanks for listening to the distributed data show please subscribe with your favorite podcast app give us
